author: Special Correspondent
text:
Goa was indeed put on a high alert during the Christmas week apprehending some trouble from terror outfit, revealed police sources here on Monday.

Speaking on the condition of anonymity, a senior police official told The Hindu that following some interceptions of some groups by international agencies, information had been passed on indicating the Islamic State (IS) or any such outfits might be planning to target Goa.

Asked about the information that terror suspects linked to the IS, arrested in a countrywide raid over the past few days, had planned to target Goa a few months ago, the official said high alert was sounded and officers in the special group had been sensitised and told to be on high alert to thwart any attempts to disrupt the State as Christmas and New Year festivities were on, said the official.
title: Goa was on high alert during Christmas: police
